ARTICLE.TITLE: Judge to retire from bench
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Judge to retire from bench

Image 1 of / 1 Caption Close Judge to retire from bench 1 / 1 Back to Gallery

CARROLLTON — Circuit Judge James W. Day will not seek retention to the bench.

Day will mark 30 years on the bench in 2020, and his current term of office as the presiding circuit judge in Greene County expires in December 2020.

The longtime judge said he could file for retention for another six-year term but has decided to retire on Dec. 6, 2020, when his term ends.

“I was honored to be elected in 1990 by the voters of Greene County and feel that the voters of Greene County should elect the next circuit judge,” Day said in a letter to the Illinois Supreme Court. “I am giving this early notice so that attorneys who are interested in running for circuit court of Greene County will be able to participate in the March 2020 primary election.”

Day earned a bachelor’s degree from MacMurray College and his law degree from the University of Illinois. He was retained by voters on Nov. 4, 2014.

Day noted that next year also has special significance for him because he and his wife, Dotty, will mark their 50th anniversary July 4.
